title: 'Europe's last dictator': I have nothing to apologize for
description: In an exclusive interview with CNN's Matthew Chance, Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko says he has "nothing to apologize for" when challenged on human rights abuses.

title: Ozy Media is shutting down after a week of scrutiny into its business
description: Ozy Media announced on Friday that it will cease operations. The decision comes five days after the The New York Times published a bombshell report about its business practices, which kicked off additional scrutiny from other media outlets.

title: Stunning display at first Russian royal wedding in over a century
description: Grand Duke George Mikhailovich Romanov, a descendant of Russia's last royal family, married his wife Rebecca Bettarini in an ornate ceremony in St. Petersburg.

title: Plane and helicopter collide midair, killing 2
description: Two people are dead after a midair collision between a helicopter and a fixed-wing plane in Arizona Friday morning, according to Chandler Fire Department spokesman Keith Welch.

title: Alabama governor signs bill to use Covid-19 relief funds to build prisons
description: Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey signed a bill to use the state's allotment of Covid-19 relief funds to build new prisons. CNN's Dianne Gallagher reports.

title: Congressman doesn't understand what a 'finsta' is
description: Sen. Richard Blumenthal grilled a Facebook executive about "finstas," or fake Instagram accounts. The slang term is primarily used to describe a private Instagram account created by teens to interact with a trusted group of family and/or friends.

title: Why October 19 could be a catastrophic day for the US economy
'It breaks my heart': Unvaccinated teacher may leave job over mandate
description: New York City public school teacher Stephanie Edmonds tells CNN's Alisyn Camerota why she is choosing to leave her job over the city's vaccine mandate.

title: Snowcone the Happy Unicorn is the latest victim of manufacturing chaos
description: The holiday season isn't looking so merry for Dena Fargo this year. Her best-selling toy, a multi-colored, smiling stuffed animal called Snowcone the Happy Unicorn, won't make it to eager parents and kids this year.

title: Scarlett Johansson and Disney agree to end lawsuit
description: Scarlett Johansson and Disney resolved their dispute over the lawsuit that Johansson filed against the company. She alleged that Disney breached her contract by releasing "Black Widow," a Marvel film starring the actress, on Disney+ on the same day it was released in theaters.

title: Car sales plunge as chip shortages choke off supply
description: New car sales plunged over the last three months in the United States despite strong demand, as the shortage of computer chips and other supply chain issues caused shutdowns at auto factories and choked off the supply of vehicles.

title: Architect on plans to bring home famous artifacts looted by British Empire
description: CNN's Larry Madowo speaks with award-winning architect and designer Sir David Adjaye about his plans to bring home the famous Benin Bronzes, which were taken by the British army in a raid on the Kingdom of Benin, in present-day Nigeria, in 1897.

title: $19,000 a night: Richard Branson's Moskito Island debuts two new luxury estates
description: It certainly won't come cheap, but Sir Richard Branson's new private-island getaway in the British Virgin Islands -- where you can stay in a luxurious villa staffed by a private chef and resident manager who creates a "hyper-personalized" itinerary for each guest -- is the stuff of daydreams and bucket lists.

title: Former Malawian lawmaker shoots himself dead in parliament
description: A former member of Malawi's parliament killed himself inside the parliament building in the capital Lilongwe on Thursday, a police spokesman has confirmed to CNN.

title: America's housing market is so hot a burned-out home listed at $400,000
description: The housing market has recently cooled from white hot to merely red hot. But it's still a great time to get top dollar on a home, even one that needs a little work. Or one that is a charred shell of a house.

title: A key measure of inflation surged to a new 30-year high
description: A key measure of inflation hit a new 30-year high in August, the Bureau of Economic Analysis reported Friday.

title: Banks and farmers become the next victims of the UK's worker shortage crisis
description: Worker shortages have left UK service stations empty, created gaps on supermarket shelves and are forcing farms to cull pigs. Even the finance industry is starting to suffer. The situation could get much worse this winter if the British government doesn't relax its Brexit immigration rules, business leaders say.

title: Dolly Parton reacts to Lil Nas X's cover of 'Jolene'
description: Dolly Parton is a Lil Nas X fan.

title: US Supreme Court justices are unhappy and want everyone to know it
description: Supreme Court justices have revealed a new level of defensiveness and anger in recent weeks, showing irritation with public expectations, the news media and one another.

title: Gunshots at the airport and tents in Germany. Hear one family's journey out of Afghanistan
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar talks to a family in Philadelphia about their arduous trip home from Kabul, Afghanistan, after the Taliban took over the country.

title: French former police officer identified as serial killer and rapist, ending 35-year hunt
description: After a 35-year hunt, a former police officer has been identified as being behind a series of murders, rapes and false imprisonment, French officials said Thursday.

title: London police warn women to be wary of lone officers after Sarah Everard murder
description: London's Metropolitan Police has issued advice to women approached by lone police officers in the wake of Sarah Everard's murder, including telling them to run "into a house," "wave down a bus" or call the police on 999 if they do not believe the officer is "who they say they are" after questioning them.

title: This solar event will halt communication with Mars missions for 2 weeks
description: Things are about to get a little quiet between NASA and its fleet of robotic Mars explorers. That's because an expected communication breakdown is about to happen, all thanks to the sun.

title: Japan's Princess Mako will marry her commoner fiance this month
description: Japan's Princess Mako and her commoner fiance Kei Komuro announced Friday they will be married on October 26, public broadcaster NHK reported -- a controversial union that requires her to give up her royal status.

title: Infowars host Alex Jones is responsible for damages triggered by his false claims on the Sandy Hook shooting, judge rules
description: Alex Jones, the conspiracy theorist who hosts the right-wing commentary website Infowars, was found legally responsible in two lawsuits for damages caused by his claims surrounding the 2012 Sandy Hook school mass shooting, according to court documents released Thursday.

title: How do you become a chess grandmaster? Magnus Carlsen is here to tell you
description: You don't get to be the world No. 1-ranked chess player without plotting multiple moves ahead.

title: As gas prices soar, people are mulling alternatives to heating their homes. Here's what to know
description: Soaring natural gas prices have raised the specter of cold homes and inflated energy bills for millions of people over winter across Europe and the United States, where most people rely on gas-fired boilers for heat and hot water.

title: Britney Spears' bid for freedom comes at a crucial moment
description: For 13 years, people other than Britney Spears have been running her life.

title: New bodycam footage reveals what Gabby Petito told police about a domestic dispute with fiancé Brian Laundrie
description: New details have emerged of a reported domestic dispute between Gabby Petito and her fiance while traveling through Utah in August, as shown on additional bodycam footage from a responding officer.

title: They have all the Covid-19 vaccines they need, but these EU nations are still miles behind their neighbors
Brazil legend Pele leaves hospital after surgery to remove tumor
description: Brazil football legend Pele was discharged from hospital on Thursday following surgery to remove a tumor from his colon.

title: Tropical Cyclone Gulab brings heavy rainfall to Pakistan and Iran
description: Tropical Cyclone Gulab brings heavy rain to Pakistan and Iran and is forecast to make a very rare landfall in Oman. CNN meteorologist Derek Van Dam has the forecast.

title: A first look at Expo 2020 Dubai
80 million European households struggle to stay warm. Rising energy costs will make the problem worse
description: Millions of people across Europe may not be able to afford to heat their homes this winter as gas and electricity prices soar.

title: Australia reveals plan to reopen international borders to fully vaccinated citizens
description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Friday, October 1 announced plans to reopen the country's borders to fully vaccinated citizens and permanent residents, moving from a strict zero-Covid strategy to a model of living with the virus.

title: National Women's Soccer League team North Carolina Courage fires head coach following accusations of sexual manipulation and misconduct
description: The National Women's Soccer League team North Carolina Courage fired head coach Paul Riley on Thursday afternoon following accusations of sexual coercion and misconduct by former players who were coached by him.

title: China says it's restricting abortions to promote gender equality. Experts are skeptical
description: For decades, Chinese authorities imposed strict limits on families that forced millions of women to abort pregnancies deemed illegal by the state.

title: The left defies Pelosi as Biden's big hopes are in limbo
description: An extraordinary day and night of wrenching tension, failed 11th hour deal making and festering mistrust between liberal and moderate Democrats left President Joe Biden's vast domestic agenda in a dangerous limbo.

title: South Korean volleyball twins accused of bullying sign for Greek club
description: Twin volleyball players from South Korea, Lee Jae-yeong and Lee Da-yeong, have completed a transfer to Greek club PAOK Thessaloniki, months after being dropped from their national and club sides following claims of bullying.

title: North Korea fires new anti-aircraft missile in latest test, state media says
description: North Korea fired a newly developed anti-aircraft missile on Thursday, state media KCNA reported on Friday, the latest in its recent series of weapons tests amid deadlocked denuclearization talks with the United States.

title: UK companies have to disclose gender pay gaps. It's not enough
description: Large UK companies are required to reveal their gender pay gaps. But the rules are failing to address inequality, according to a new report.

title: Ethiopia gives seven UN officials 72 hours to leave the country
description: Ethiopia is expelling seven senior United Nations officials for allegedly "meddling in the internal affairs of the country," the Ethiopian Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Thursday.

title: Deaf Colorado man who couldn't hear police commands says he was tased, spent 4 months in jail
description: A deaf Colorado man has filed a federal lawsuit claiming that two local police officers slammed him to the ground and tasered him without recognizing his disability when they arrested him after stopping him for running a stop sign.

title: Fact check: Did the Marine who Trump brought on stage at rally actually hoist a baby over a wall at Kabul airport?
description: During a rally in Georgia over the weekend, former President Donald Trump invited Lance Cpl. Hunter Clark to the stage, implying he was the Marine in a viral video who lifted a child over a wall at the airport in Kabul, Afghanistan.

title: How anti-vaxxers cling to centuries-old conspiracy theories
description: Anti-vax resistance has been around for years. In the latest "Reality Check with John Avlon: Extremist Beat," Avlon traces the anti-government, anti-science and religious overtones that have persisted through the history of anti-vax opposition with CNN's Elle Reeve and Donie O'Sullivan.

title: Passenger on plane arriving at Miami airport opens emergency exit, walks onto wing
description: A passenger on a flight from Colombia used an emergency exit and walked out onto the wing of the plane at the Miami International Airport on Wednesday evening, Miami-Dade Police said.

title: The Covid-19 vaccine health care worker holdouts: For them, it's personal. For their hospitals it's professional
description: Being a nurse means everything to Andrea Babinski, but she is willing to risk it all -- the connections to colleagues she likes, the patients she cares for, not to mention the steady paycheck -- for a simple belief.

title: Dr. Gupta asks nurse if anything would convince her to get vaccine. Hear her reply
description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta talks with nurse Andrea Babinski, who has not been vaccinated for coronavirus despite a mandate from her employer and the possibility she may lose her job for refusing to get the shot.

title: Rock legend walks into a bar and nobody notices
description: Mick Jagger gets a beer at a dive bar and nobody recognizes him. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on the photo that rocked Stones fans.

title: Scarlett Johansson and Disney agree to end lawsuit
description: Scarlett Johansson vs. Disney is over.
